result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on April 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:29 AM Defendant Kirk James Walczak in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with attorney Christian J Ness, appearing by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case (22CF67, 33CM25) and recites appearances.  State indicates Information filed that mirrors complaint, not yet received into case.  Atty Ness has no objection to proceeding if INFO mirrors complaint, enters NG plea on behalf of  DEF.  Court enters NG plea.  Atty Ness requests to be heard on bond modification motion in 22CF67.  State has no objection.  Atty Ness argues for bond modification in 22CF67.  State opposes modifying bond.  Atty Ness makes additional statement, State responds.  Court denies bond modification motion.  Court sets STC for 4/26/22 at 11AM.  
  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:32 AM Defendant Kirk James Walczak in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak (special appearance).  Defendant Kirk James Walczak in custody appears by video. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court continues- initial appearance on Count 1 for  entry of plea to Count 1.  Bond Continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  Warrant quashed.  Attny Otten indicates DEF does not qualify for PD appointment.  Received notification from Public Defenders Office, DEF does not qualify for PD appointment, and was given instructions to contact Clerk of Court Office to apply for court appointed attorney.   Attny Otten makes statement as to missed appearance.   DEF makes statement to court about missed appearance.   Court has discussion with DEF.   Court sets bond.  SIBS $500   Court resets the initial appearance.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
